result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald James Leifker Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant has 131 day's of sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay restitution in Case No. 15-CF-65 to the Shullsburg Public Schools in the amount of $653.00, and restitution in Case No. 15-CF-64 to Heather Christopher, d/b/a Shag & Wag, in the amount of $884.40.

Defendant shall pay the court costs in the amount of $268.00.
Defendant shall pay a DNA Analysis Surcharge in the amount of $250.00.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald James Leifker Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:12 AM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This matter is resolved with a global resolution (Plea Agreement).
Attorney Witt files plea and waiver of rights form.
Defendant enters a plea of "GUILTY" to Count 1.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Witt re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver of rights is made freely, knowingly & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Count 1
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties 8.5 years
--3.5 years initial confinement
--5 years extended supervision
>>131 days of sentence credit.
Attorney Witt makes statement on behalf of his client.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

THE COURT: Slight Variation of the parties and orderes defendant to 4 years of initial confinement with 5 years of extended supervision. (9 years Total)
Eligible for programming.
131 Day's sentence credit.

Case called at 1:21 PM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Witt informs the court this matter will be resolved  by a global resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on March 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 9:24 AM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Continue for status.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 2:33 PM.
Defendant Ronald James Leifker and Attorney Adam Thomas Witt not in court. Prosecuting Atty Katherine M. Findley appeared for State of Wisconsin.
DA Findley informs the court she has had conversations with Attorney Witt, and moves to continue this matter.
So ordered.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Proposed Verdict Forms & Voir Dire Questions

Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called at 10:09 AM.
Attorney Witt moves for bond modification.
State objects to the modification for reasons stated on the record.
Court grants modification with specific conditions, see bail bond for comlete list.

Defendant shall have a curfew between 5:00 PM and 8:00 AM., defendant cannot be out of the residence at all.
Defendant shall not be out of the residence between 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM, with out the presence of his mother.
There will be no alcohol or drugs on or at the residence where Mr. Leifker is living.
Defendant shall submit to testing by law enforcement for the presence of drugs or alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall not consume any controlled substance unless the substance is prescribed as medication for the defendant by the defendant's physician.
Defendant shall inform the court with in 48 hours of employment.
Letter with Judge Jorgenson RE: Jury Trial Order

Telephone scheduling conference at 10-23-2015 10:00 am.
Motion hearing at 11-17-2015 02:00 pm.
Jury trial at 12-09-2015 09:00 am.

Defendant Ronald James Leifker in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Ronald James Leifker in custody.   Katherine Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case Called at 9:14 AM.

Attorney Pecora moves for sequestration of witnesses.

State calls Rick Moyer to the stand.
>>Rick Moyer is affirmed and testifies.

Direct by DA Findley
Witness identifies the defendant.

Cross by Attorney Pecora

Re Direct by DA Findley

Witness excused at 9:30 AM.

ARGUMENT: State believes probable cause was shown.

Attorney Pecora argues his position questions 2 felony cases, and moves to dismiss this case no probable cause at all.



Court finds: Probable cause has been found, and orders the defendant be bound over for arraignment.

State files information.
Attorney Pecora waives formal reading of the information.

Attorney Pecora files Demand for Discovery & Speedy Trial.

Defendant stands "MUTE"

Court enter plea of "NOT GUILTY" on behalf of the defendant (all counts)

Motions due on 11/02/2015
Response/Reply due by 11/09/2015

Telephon Scheduling Conference 10/23/2015
Motion Hearing date 11/17/2015.
Jury trial scheduled for December 09, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Pecora moves for bond modification.
DA Findley objects to the modification.

The Court: BOND STANDS

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. 
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not consume or possess any alcoholic beverage.
